about_title.message: Welcome to the Google Maps Santa Tracker!

about-content-one.description: One of three paragraphs describing the Santa Tracker website. Tone should be whimsical. The Dashboard will be a google map with information displayed on top, like the name of the city he's in, the number of presents delivered, the current temperature, etc.
about-content-one.message: On Christmas Eve we’ll be proudly showcasing a Santa’s dashboard, the technology that powers his sleigh during his around-the-world journey. We’ve received this special preview from one of Santa’s many developer elves, who are hard at work in the North Pole helping Santa prepare for his big day. Santa’s dashboard - featuring the latest and greatest in Google Maps technology and sleigh engineering - will allow you to follow his progress around the world, and also learn a little about some of his stops along the way.

about-content-two.description: One of three paragraphs describing the Santa Tracker website. Tone should be whimsical. The Village is the main navigation for Santa Tracker.
about-content-two.message: Our friendly elves have also invited you to explore Santa’s village while Santa gets ready for his journey. So go ahead and explore his village, you might just find some fun activities and meet some interesting elves.

about-content-three.description: One of three paragraphs describing the Santa Tracker website. Tone should be light, but direct, as it links people to more help.
about-content-three.raw: The Google Maps Santa Tracker is created and developed by Google, with a little help from Santa’s elves. Need help or have another question? Visit our <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="//support.google.com/santatracker"></ph>Help Center<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph>.

about-santa.description: Link text. Please keep this short. Links to the Santa Tracker About page. Page supplies more info about the project.

ar_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

ar_language_name.description: Localised name of a language. Appears in a translation drop down.

ar_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
ar_tradition.message: In Argentina, Christmas begins promptly at midnight. Many families kick off the holiday by hosting festive celebrations in their homes, opening gifts with their loved ones, and lighting fireworks in the early hours of the morning.

au_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

au_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
au_tradition.message: Australia's Southern Hemisphere location means it's summer time in December. Instead of sleigh bells and cocoa, many Australians head to the beach to celebrate the holidays with a prawn lunch and a few rounds of cricket.

back_to_tracker.description: Link to go back to the santa tracker screen.

br_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

br_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
br_tradition.message: Christmas celebrations start near midnight, usually with big family dinners, gift opening, and the celebration of the 'Missa do Galo' (the rooster's mass) in churches. Despite the warm tropical summer weather, themes of winter and snow are not uncommon.

ca_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

ca_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
ca_tradition.message: Canadian children usually celebrate a snowy, white Christmas. They bundle up in their scarves and toques, a Canadian woolen hat, to play in the snow, ice-skate, and toboggan! On Christmas Eve, they leave milk and cookies by the fireplace for Santa (and sometimes a carrot for his reindeer).

de_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
de_tradition.message: In nearly Every German town Christmas markets open in town squares. Townspeople gather to hear brass bands, and enjoy traditional fare of the region. They eat gingerbread hearts, sugar-roasted almonds, sweets of all kinds, and drink mulled wine (Glühwein) or apple cider.

donate_button.description: Label for a button that allows users to donate.

donate_text.description: Information about donations and that Google will match 50% of all user donations. Don't translate '#ForEveryKid', or the DonorsChoose.org domain link.
donate_text.message: Help fund a special needs project on DonorsChoose.org. This December, we're helping to double the impact by matching donations by 50%, until we reach our goal of donating US$1m. Together, we can help to make classrooms more inclusive #ForEveryKid

endofjourneymessage.message: Santa's finished his journey for the year! He and the elves are still having some fun in the North Pole before their annual vacation.

error-lost-connection.description: Paragraph text that appears on our error page. The error page might appear in the event of a 404, or other similar problems. Text should be non-specific and light hearted.
error-lost-connection.message: Looks like we just lost our connection with the North Pole. Santa's elves are working hard to fix it - stay tuned!

finished-text.message: Happy Holidays! Santa has completed his journey around the world and is taking a much deserved break. Visit us again next year!

fr_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
fr_tradition.message: In France, children traditionally put their shoes out next to the fireplace in anticipation of Père Noël's arrival. If children have been good throughout the year, Père Noël will fill the shoes with gifts.

getgooglemaps.description: Describes using the Google Maps product to find Santa.

gh_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

gh_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
gh_tradition.message: Christmas in Ghana includes the whole family. Adults dress up in costumes and hand out candy and sweets around the neighborhood. Children decorate their homes with paper ornaments and drawings they make at school.

gotovillage.description: A link to Santa's Village. One method of site navigation.

gr_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

gr_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
gr_tradition.message: In Greece, friendly but troublesome creatures called 'kallikántzari' live most of the year in the center of the earth. But at Christmas, they love to hide in people's houses, frightening people, playing tricks, or devouring Christmas foods. Greeks perform rituals to keep these hobgoblins away.

gt_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
gt_tradition.message: Guatemalans celebrate Christmas with fun and dancing. They wear hats called Puritina, eat Guatemalan style tamales, light firecrackers at midnight, and dance the night away with various styles of dancing.

is_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
is_tradition.message: At Christmas time in Iceland, families give gifts of warm clothing to each member of their household. According to legend, there is a frightening Christmas Cat who gobbles up anyone not equipped for the cold and wintery weather. Families work together to ensure nobody will 'go to the Christmas Cat.'

kg_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
kg_tradition.message: In Kyrgyzstan, Ayaz Ata (Grandfather Frost) comes at midnight on New Year's Eve and leaves presents under the New Year tree. When the clock strikes midnight, families throughout the country light fireworks to celebrate this beautiful occasion. The cities become as bright as day.

mx_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
mx_tradition.message: In Mexico, kids of all ages celebrate Christmas by breaking pinatas. Adults and children have fun by wearing a blindfold, spinning around, and swinging a stick to break open the star-shaped hanging pots. When the pinata is smashed open, nuts, fruit and candy spill out for everyone to enjoy.

nonprofit-jane-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-jane-description.raw: Chimpanzees are human being's closest living relatives in the animal kingdom! Today, there are fewer than 300,000 chimpanzees remaining due to habitat loss, disease and illegal trade. The Jane Goodall Institute (JGI) protects chimpanzees by observing and understanding their behaviors as well as the habitats in which they live. JGI also works to build a community of people who are protecting and conserving wildlife and the environment we share. <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="//www.google.com/maps/about/behind-the-scenes/streetview/treks/gombe-tanzania/"></ph>Explore the Chimpanzee habitats<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph> in Gombe, Tanzania.

nonprofit-jane-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Work is defined very broadly. eg. a type of animal, water, sun, etc.

nonprofit-more-information.description: Is followed by a URL to a nonprofit. This appears in a print-out and the URL is sometimes in a new line, other times to the right. 40 chars max.

nonprofit-nature-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-nature-description.message: The Nature Conservancy works to protect and restore forests in the United States and around the world. These iconic forests sustain life around the planet. They filter water, clean our air, support communities of people and provide habitat for important plant and animal species. At the current rate of deforestation, our forests will be wiped out within 100 years. The Nature Conservancy’s Plant a Billion Trees program is working to plant one billion trees by 2025 and restore the world’s most critical forests.

nonprofit-nature-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Work is defined very broadly. eg. a type of animal, water, sun, etc.

nonprofit-wwf-description.description: The description of a non-profit organization. Descriptions are supplied by the non-profit organization. Please do not translate the name of the non-profit.
nonprofit-wwf-description.raw: Climate change continues to disrupt the balance of many of the world’s ecosystems, both warm and cold places. In the Arctic, polar bears are losing their sea ice habitat with rising temperatures, and face added threats from human activities, such as oil and gas development and shipping. World Wildlife Fund works to ensure the survival of the species through scientific research and working in partnership with Arctic native communities. Google.org is proud to be a <ph name="BEGIN_LINK"><ex><a href="link"></ex><a href="https://www.worldwildlife.org/stories/google-helps-wwf-stop-wildlife-crime"></ph> supporter<ph name="END_LINK"><ex></a></ex></a></ph> with World Wildlife Fund.

nonprofit-wwf-type.description: The type of work that the non-profit supports. Work is defined very broadly. eg. a type of animal, water, sun, etc.

nz_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

nz_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
nz_tradition.message: Because Christmas is in the summer in New Zealand, friends and family gather round a barbecue. Typical Christmas meals include roast lamb, sometimes cooked in a 'hangi' - an underground pit or earth oven. A favorite dessert is pavlova: meringue covered in fresh fruit like strawberries and kiwifruit.

ph_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
ph_tradition.message: The Philippines is known for having the world's longest Christmas season. Four months are considered Christmas months: September, October, November, December. Christmas carols can oftentimes be heard as early as the beginning of September.

ru_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
ru_tradition.message: Russian children decorate a New Year's tree, instead of a Christmas tree. Children wait with longing for Grandfather Frost who travels with his granddaughter Snowmaiden, delivering presents across the land. Grandfather Frost lives deep in the woods in Veliky Ustyug, in northern Russia.

uk_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

uk_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
uk_tradition.message: In the United Kingdom, merrymakers of all ages enjoy Christmas crackers on the table at dinner. Crackers are tubes wrapped in colorful paper, with pull tabs on each end. When you pull the tabs, the tube bursts with a loud snap! Inside are paper hats, toys and candy to enjoy during Christmas night.

us_country_name.description: Name of a country. This appears as a label in a game that teaches children about holiday traditions from around the world.

us_tradition.description: Describes a local holiday tradition. Restrict to 300 characters.
us_tradition.message: In the United States, stockings are hung on Christmas Eve. The legend goes that St Nicholas heard of a family in need. To surprise them, he climbed down their chimney and placed precious bags of gold in hanging stockings. From this point, St Nicholas was known as Santa Claus, giver of gifts.

codeboogie-result-wrong-move.description: Short hint when the user performs a wrong step, showing the right step to use instead. The right step appears below.
codeboogie-result-wrong-move.message: Seems like you did the wrong move there. Try this one instead:

codeboogie-result-too-many-blocks-succes.description: Short hint on how the puzzle can be improved even if level is complete. One or two sentences max. Has a token for a dynamic number between 2-6, the token can be skipped and translation worded that fewer blocks are needed.
codeboogie-result-too-many-blocks-succes.message: Did you know you can finish this dance with just {{ideal}} blocks?

codeboogie-result-missing-block-fail.description: Short hint after failing a level. One or two sentences max. Refers to blocks visually displayed below.
codeboogie-result-missing-block-fail.message: Try the block below to match the dance.

codeboogie-result-missing-block-success.description: Short hint on how the puzzle can be improved even if level is complete. One or two sentences max. Refers to blocks visually displayed below. Has a token for a dynamic number between 2-6, the token can be skipped and translation worded that fewer blocks are needed.
codeboogie-result-missing-block-success.message: Did you know you can finish this dance with just {{ideal}} blocks? Try using the block below.

codeboogie-result-perfect-success.description: Short message after completing a level. One or two sentences max.
codeboogie-result-perfect-success.message: Nice moves! You finished the dance perfectly.

codeboogie-result-too-few-blocks-fail.description: Short hint after failing a level. One or two sentences max.
codeboogie-result-too-few-blocks-fail.message: You are using the right blocks, but try using more of them to complete the dance.

codeboogie-go.description: Overlay on mode and stage select shown on hover. Needs to be a single word.

codeboogie-choose-game-mode.description: Large title telling the user to pick between classes and freestyle modes. Single sentence.

codeboogie-choose-stage.description: Large title telling the user to pick a location (stage). Single sentence.

codeboogie-mode-dance-class.description: Title for gameplay mode where the user copies a dance teacher.

codeboogie-mode-dance-class-description.description: Small text shown below dance class title. Single sentence.

codeboogie-mode-freestyle.description: Title for gameplay mode where user can make up their own dances.

codeboogie-mode-freestyle-description.description: Small text show below freestyle title. Single sentence.
codeboogie-mode-freestyle-description.message: Make your own moves and share with friends

codeboogie-share-moves.description: Subtitle that encourages the user to click the share button.
codeboogie-share-moves.message: Share your moves and challenge your friends

codeboogie-back-to-start.description: Link text for going from the pick a stage screen (second screen) back to the gameplay mode screen (first screen).

codeboogie-keep-dancing.description: Button text to continue making your own dance in freestyle mode.

codelab-block-whenrun.description: Code block label. 15char limit. Start of the code, reads to indicate that blocks below it will execute in order

codelab-block-moveeast.description: Code block label for moving the player east. Preferably just one word for the direction.

codelab-block-moveeast-tooltip.description: Tooltip for a code block which moves the player east. Written as a command in first person.

codelab-block-movenorth.description: Code block label for moving the player north. Preferably just one word for the direction.

codelab-block-movenorth-tooltip.description: Tooltip for a code block which moves the player north. Written as a command in first person.

codelab-block-movesouth.description: Code block label for moving the player south. Preferably just one word for the direction.

codelab-block-movesouth-tooltip.description: Tooltip for a code block which moves the player south. Written as a command in first person.

codelab-block-movewest.description: Code block label for moving the player west. Preferably just one word for the direction.

codelab-block-movewest-tooltip.description: Tooltip for a code block which moves the player west. Written as a command in first person.

codelab-block-repeat.description: Code block label. 15char limit. Is followed by a editable number and another label like this "repeat 5 times". Sadly the labels can't be reordered for technical reasons.

codelab-block-repeat-times.description: Code block label. 15char limit. Placed after a circle arrow (indicating repeat) and an editable number, i.e. repeat 5 times.

codelab-block-repeat-tooltip.description: Tooltip for code block which repeats one or more statements.

codelab-block-jump-length.description: Code block label. 15char limit. Placed after a jump arrow (indicating a jump) and before an editable number, i.e. jump over 5.

codelab-block-jump-tooltip.description: Tooltip for code block which tells player to jump over tiles.

codelab-finish.description: Button label to end game. 15char limit.

codelab-great.description: Huge success title after finishing a level. 15char limit.

codelab-mwc-promo.description: Promotion for the Made w/ Code initiative. Displayed in footer of code lab game. Should be short and direct.
codelab-mwc-promo.raw: Explore more Google coding projects at <ph name="LINK"><ex><a href="link">link</a></ex><a href="//www.madewithcode.com/" target="_blank">MadewithCode.com</a></ph>.

codelab-next-challenge.description: Button label to start next level. 15char limit.

codelab-oops.description: Huge whimsical title after failing a level. 15char limit.

codelab-result-empty-repeat-fail.description: Short hint after failing a level. One or two sentences max.
codelab-result-empty-repeat-fail.message: The "Repeat" block needs to have other blocks inside it to work.

codelab-result-extra-top-block-fail.description: Short hint after failing a level. One or two sentences max.
codelab-result-extra-top-block-fail.message: Some of the blocks are not attached together properly.

codelab-result-generic-fail.description: Short generic message after failing a level. One or two sentences max.

codelab-result-missing-block-fail.description: Short hint after failing a level. One or two sentences max. Refers to blocks visually displayed below.
codelab-result-missing-block-fail.message: Try one or more of the block below to solve this puzzle.

codelab-result-missing-block-success.description: Short hint on how the puzzle can be improved even if level is complete. One or two sentences max. Refers to blocks visually displayed below. Has a token for a dynamic number between 2-6, the token can be skipped and translation worded that fewer blocks are needed.
codelab-result-missing-block-success.raw: Did you know you can finish this level with just <ph name="IDEAL"><ex>4</ex>{{ideal}}</ph> blocks? Try using the block below.

codelab-result-perfect-success.description: Short message after completing a level. One or two sentences max.
codelab-result-perfect-success.message: Congratulations! You finished the puzzle perfectly.

codelab-result-too-few-blocks-fail.description: Short hint after failing a level. One or two sentences max.
codelab-result-too-few-blocks-fail.message: You are using the right blocks, but try using more of them to complete this puzzle.

codelab-result-too-many-blocks-success.description: Short hint on how the puzzle can be improved even if level is complete. One or two sentences max. Has a token for a dynamic number between 2-6, the token can be skipped and translation worded that fewer blocks are needed.
codelab-result-too-many-blocks-success.raw: Did you know you can finish this level with just <ph name="IDEAL"><ex>4</ex>{{ideal}}</ph> blocks?

codelab-try-again.description: Button label to try the level again after failing or completing with room for improvement. 15char limit.

language.description: Button text. Please keep short. Used to open the language chooser to change the language

select-language.description: Title of the langage select options area

error.description: Shown on the error page (if anything went wron)
error.message: Looks like we just lost our connection with the North Pole. Santa's elves are working hard to fix it - stay tuned!

error_try_again.description: Button text. Shown on the error page (if anything went wron)

scene_airport.description: Title of a scene/game. Elves are arriving at the "North Pole Airport".

scene_app.description: Title of a scene/game. This takes the user to the Santa Android App available on Google Play..

scene_boatload.description: Title of a scene/game. Game to launch presents at targets.

scene_briefing.description: Title of a scene/game. Mrs. Claus' is giving a briefing on how to deliver presents.

scene_codeboogie.description: Title of a scene/game. You can teach Santa's Elves how to dance ('boogie') through code.

scene_codelab.description: Title of a scene/game. Instruct an elf to deliver a present through code.

scene_commandcentre.description: Title of a scene/game. Provides insights into the present delivery process: Elves looking at monitors, adjusting knobs, loading presents into bags etc.

scene_callfromsanta.description: Title of a scene/game. This lets Santa call your phone number and give a greeting.

scene_citylights.description: Title of a scene/game. Showcases different Street View scenes, containing holiday lights and decorations, from around the world.

scene_giftmatch.description: Title of a scene/game. Match presents in a gem-matcher style game.

scene_gumball.description: Title of a scene/game. Drop gumballs (round lollies) through a scene, tilting to ensure they reach their destination.

scene_jamband.description: Title of a scene/game. Create your own custom band arrangement with Santa's Elves.

scene_jetpack.description: Title of a scene/game. Fly through the air and collect presents while avoiding obstacles.

scene_matching.description: Title of a scene/game. Traditional matching game, click doors to see items and try to pair them off.

scene_mercator.description: Title of a scene/game. Learn about different countries and find their place on the map.

scene_postcard.description: Title of a scene/game. Generate postcards and share them with your friends.

scene_presentbounce.description: Title of a scene/game. Create a "Rube Goldberg"-style machine to bounce presents into a bag.

scene_presentdrop.description: Title of a scene/game. Practice dropping presents into practice chimneys.

scene_racer.description: Title of a scene/game. Race Rudolph through the snow, collecting the most presents along the way.

scene_santasearch.description: Title of a scene/game. A "Where's Wally/Waldo"-style (not affiliated) experience to find Santa in tricky scenes.

scene_santaselfie.description: Title of a scene/game. Give Santa a new hairstyle.

scene_seasonofcaring.description: Title of a scene/game. Learn about different charities with a disability focus, and paint baubles.

scene_seasonofgiving.description: Title of a scene/game. Learn about different charities, and paint baubles.

scene_traditions.description: Title of a scene/game. Learn about different holiday traditions from around the world.

scene_translations.description: Title of a scene/game. Translate common holiday phrases to and from different languages.

scene_videoscene_carpool.description: Title of a video scene. Plays a video with elves getting out of a tiny car.

scene_videoscene_liftoff.description: Title of a video scene. Santa is taking off, launching etc.

scene_videoscene_santasback.description: Title of a video scene. Alternative meaning is 'Santa has returned'.

scene_windtunnel.description: Title of a scene/game. Watch Rudolph's flying skills be tested in a wind tunnel.

tracker_your_location.description: Heading where the location of the user is displayed below

tracker_gifts_delivered.description: Heading where the number of gifts delivered so far is displayed below

tracker_departing_in.description: Heading that displays how long till Santa departs

tracker_arriving_in.description: Heading that displays how long till Santa arrives

tracker_next_stop.description: Heading above the next stop for Santa

tracker_current_stop.description: Heading above the current stop for Santa

tracker_distance_from_you.description: Heading above a number that displays how far Santa is from your location

tracker_intro_welcome.description: An intro text at the Tracker intro overlay.

tracker_intro_user_location.description: Text before the name of the user's current location.

tracker_intro_skip_intro.description: Text on the skip intro button, which hides the Tracker intro.

tracker_see_route.description: Text underneath button in the tracker menu to show Santa's route. Please keep this short.

today_only.description: A heading above menu items that are only available today. Please keep this short.

tracker_track.description: Menu item, an imperative action for a user to use the Tracker part of Santa Tracker.

today_only_1.description: A heading above menu items that are only available today. Please keep this short.

notification.description: Label for a toggle button enabling and disabling notifications

notification_notice.description: Describing what will happen if notifications are enabled
notification_notice.message: Santa's Elves will keep you up-to-date with Santa's schedule

tracker_flight_start.description: Notice message that Santa has taken off and that he's able to be followed
tracker_flight_start.message: Santa has departed from the North Pole, and you can now follow his route

tracker_flight_nearby.description: Notice that Santa is nearby and that he's able to be tracked
tracker_flight_nearby.message: Santa is nearby, find out where

village_explore.description: The intro blurb for Santa's Village, can be medium-sized
village_explore.message: Explore, play and learn with Santa's Elves all December long

village_comeback.description: Callout to ask users to come back later
village_comeback.message: Come back on the 24th and help us track Santa all night!

village_get_the_app.description: Menu item indicating that a user should get the Santa Android app from the Google Play Store.
village_get_the_app.message: Get the Santa Tracker App for Android

village_santa_cast.description: Menu item for finding Santa on the Google Cast platform. Don't translate 'Google Cast'.

village_santa_crx.description: Menu item for adding Santa as a Google Chrome extension. Don't translate "Chrome".

village_santa_cardboard.description: Menu item for finding Santa as part of an app which supports Google Cardboard (Google's Virtual Reality experience). Don't translate 'Cardboard'.

village_takesoff.description: Message describing when Santa Takes off, will be followed by a countdown

village_more.description: Menu item to find more ways to learn, play, explore etc about Santa.

santasearch_search_for_santa.description: A heading for the level selection screen.

santasearch_level_select.description: Appears when a level in the Santa Search game has been hovered in the level selection screen. Please keep this below 10 characters.

santasearch_level_museum.description: Name of the Santa Search's game museum level, appears below the level art. Please try to keep this below 20 characters.

santasearch_level_lab.description: Name of the Santa Search's game lab level, appears below the level art. Please try to keep this below 20 characters.

santasearch_hint.description: Label for the button to click when searching for a character in the Santa Search game to get a hint of his location. This should preferably be one word.

santasearch_character_santa.description: The name of a character that can be found in a Search game, Santa.

santasearch_character_mrs_claus.description: The name of a character that can be found in a Search game, the wife of Santa Claus.

santasearch_character_rudolph.description: The name of a character that can be found in a Search game, Rudolph the Reindeer.

santasearch_character_penguin.description: The name of a character that can be found in a Search game, a penguin who lives at the North Pole.

santasearch_character_gingerbread_man.description: The name of a character that can be found in a Search game, a gingerbread man.

santasearch_character_pegman.description: The name of a character that can be found in a Search game, the Google Maps pegman.
